points.point: Sequential programming is a programming paradigm where instructions are executed one after another in a specific.
sub_points: In this paradigm, instructions are executed in the single thread.

points.point: Concurrent programming is a programming paradigm in which instructions are executed simultaneously, independently of each other.
sub_points: In this paradigm, instructions are executed in the multi thread or coroutine.
In this paradigm, tasks are not executed parallel.
In this paradigm, only one task is processed at a time and other tasks are suspended.

points.point: Parallel programming is a programming paradigm in which instructions are executed at a time and in parallel.
sub_points: In this paradigm, instructions are executed by multi cores or processors.
Unlike Concurrent programming in this paradigm, tasks are executed together and their execution processes at a time.
